body:
Ah, did we complete `model run` support on Windows @akshaya-a? I know we support the tracking server, but I'm not sure if conda-backed project running is expected to work.

You should be able to activate the conda environment manually and run this with `--no-conda`, at least.
I've experienced the same thing for `mlflow ui`

My github run works in mlflow 1.0.0, but updating to 1.1.0 seems to introduce this specific FileNotFoundError issue (Python 3.7.3). 

mlflow 1.0.0 (this works):
```
conda activate mlflow-64fbd080731679d3cbe97b8d444a57b69aed8112 && python src/features/build_features.py && python src/models/train_model.py
```

mlflow 1.1.0 (this doesn't): 
``` 
source C:\Users\zanasrul\AppData\Local\Continuum\anaconda3\condabin\..\Scripts/../etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate mlflow-64fbd080731679d3cbe97b8d444a57b69aed8112 1>&
2 && python src/features/build_features.py && python src/models/train_model.py 
```
This issue is noticed in latest 1.2 version as well. Do we have any workaround or fix for samee?

With mlflow 1.2 and Python 3.7 and trying to run multistep_workflow project from examples git and getting the below error

2019/09/18 15:30:53 INFO mlflow.projects: === Running command 'source C:\Program Files\miniconda3\Scripts/../etc/profile.d/conda.sh && conda activate mlflow-3523e1f70a6145c6a0cd1705275ffde004dc1f47 1>&2 && python main.py --als-max-iter 10 --keras-hidden-units 20 --max-row-limit 100000' in run with ID 'badc8f57f5f0486db7fc0bcd64b3b247' ===

......
......
......

OR

mlflow run  https://github.com/amesar/mlflow-fun.git#examples/hello_world -Palpha=100 -Prun_origin=GitRun -Plog_artifact=True

I get...

I am getting while running: examples/hyperparam
Do we have a solution for that? Or is there any other branch where we have a runnable build?
Exactly the same issue. Really want to try it in my Windows workstation, and hope it will be fixed shortly. Thanks.

With mlflow 1.4.0, python 3.6 and conda 4.7.12, this issue can be fixed by changing this line in the source code.
File `mlflow\projects\__init__.py`, line 687
`return ["conda.bat activate %s" % (conda_env_name)]`
Windows CreateProcess could not find the file conda because it actually points to conda.bat in an Anaconda prompt.

> With mlflow 1.4.0, python 3.6 and conda 4.7.12, this issue can be fixed by changing this line in the source code.
> File mlflow\projects__init__.py, line 687
> `return ["conda.bat activate %s" % (conda_env_name)]`
> Windows CreateProcess could not find the file conda because it actually points to conda.bat in an Anaconda prompt.

For MLFlow 1.5, the change is in line 620 - it's the same 'get_conda_command' function again. that should be a quick PR to fix?
